title: Early on the Bay
content: The water between the rocks  sounds like the giggles  of an alien child.  The silence is  pierced  by birdsong.  And I am all too aware  of the time passing,  but it's time  well spent.  I am solitary,  but not alone.  The difference is telling,  but I'm used to it now.  The sun feels so good,  like a hug by the fire  after a stormy winter day.  The bay water sparkles with  white gold,  blinding even as they beckon.  but I'm not ready  to go.
contentWithMarkup:
The water between the rocks

sounds like the giggles

of an alien child.

The silence is

pierced

by birdsong.

And I am all too aware

of the time passing,

but it's time

well spent.

I am solitary,

but not alone.

The difference is telling,

but I'm used to it now.

The sun feels so good,

like a hug by the fire

after a stormy winter day.

The bay water sparkles with

white gold,

blinding even as they beckon.

but I'm not ready

to go.

feed.name: Beyond Panic
feed.description: "As long as there is breath in me, that long I will persist." Og Mandino
